sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"送出，发送，传送"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: send, deliver, dispatch, forward, ship, transmit
means: send ： 普通最常用词，含义广。指把人或物由一地送往另一地，而不涉及事物的内容或 送的方式。
deliver ： 指把信件、包裹等物寄发出去或交到某地，或直接交与某人，着重发送这一行为。
dispatch ： 指为特殊目的而发送或派遣，强调紧急或快速。
forward ： 指经过其他人或手段把东西转送给某人。
ship ： 把通过水运、陆运或空运等方式运送东西。现常指商业上的运货，或将物品托运。
transmit ： 指将文件、消息等的内容或类似的东西发至某地或传达给他人。

word_mean: 除去：如除去胎儿或胎盘或眼的晶体

sentence.Network_en: I have orders to deliver it to Mr Demiris personally.
sentence.Network_cn: 我奉命要把它送给德米里斯先生本人。

sentence.Network_en: The Canadians plan to deliver more food to southern Somalia.
sentence.Network_cn: 加拿大计划向索马里南部地区运送更多的食品。

sentence.Network_en: As long as I deliver the goods, my boss is very happy.
sentence.Network_cn: 只要我做好本职工作，我的老板就很高兴。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)provide that which is promised or expected

lj.lj_ly: Before leaving I delivered myself of a few choice comments.
lj.lj_ls: 离开之前，我发表了一些精心准备的评论

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French delivrer, based on Latin de- 'away' + liberare 'set free'

entry.def: If you deliver something somewhere, you take it there.

example.ex: The Canadians plan to deliver more food to southern Somalia...
example.tran: 加拿大计划向索马里南部地区运送更多的食品。

example.ex: The spy returned to deliver a second batch of classified documents...
example.tran: 那名间谍返回来递送第二批机密文件。

entry.def: If you deliver something that you have promised to do, make, or produce, you do, make, or produce it.

example.ex: They have yet to show that they can really deliver working technologies...
example.tran: 他们尚未证明自己真的能够开发出实用技术。

example.ex: ... proving they could deliver the vote in their areas...
example.tran: 证明他们能够得到自己选区的选票

entry.def: If you deliver a person or thing into someone's care, you give them responsibility for that person or thing.

example.ex: Mrs Montgomery was delivered into Mr Hinchcliffe's care...
example.tran: 蒙哥马利夫人托给了欣奇利夫先生照顾。

example.ex: David delivered Holly gratefully into the woman's outstretched arms...
example.tran: 戴维非常感激地把霍利送进那个女人张开的双臂中。

entry.def: If you deliver a lecture or speech, you give it in public.

example.ex: The president will deliver a speech about schools...
example.tran: 总统将就学校问题发表讲话。

example.ex: It is shocking that only one woman has delivered the lecture in 44 years.
example.tran: 在 44 年间仅有一名女性作过讲座，这真令人震惊。

entry.def: When someone delivers a baby, they help the woman who is giving birth to the baby.

example.ex: Her husband had to deliver the baby himself.
example.tran: 她丈夫不得不自己接生孩子。

entry.def: If someone delivers a blow to someone else, they hit them.

example.ex: Those blows to the head could have been delivered by a woman.
example.tran: 头部所受的那些重击有可能出自一个女人之手。

entry.def: If someone delivers you from something, they rescue or save you from it.

example.ex: I have given thanks to God for delivering me from that pain.
example.tran: 我感谢上帝把我从那种痛苦中拯救出来。

sentences.sentence: "The commencement speaker presented a forceful speech that impressed the students"

means.word_mean: 2. bring to a destination, make a delivery;
3. to surrender someone or something to another;

sentences.sentence: "the guard delivered the criminal to the police"

means.word_mean: 5. hand over to the authorities of another country;

sentences.sentence: "They extradited the fugitive to his native country so he could be tried there"
"The students delivered a cry of joy"
"The boxer drove home a solid left"
"The squatters had to surrender the building after the police moved in"

means.word_mean: 11. throw or hurl from the mound to the batter, as in baseball;

stems_affixes.value_cn: 递送, 陈述, 释放, 发表
stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉+liver自由→释放自由→送出,释放

Sentence.sentence: Companies are employing in-house versions of Facebook and creating their own "app stores" to deliver software to employees.
We can perhaps claim compensation from the steel suppliers for failure to deliver on time.
They cannot deliver the steel sheets on time
They resonated(共鸣) with optimism and ambition in much the same way as the most famous dream speech of all, delivered by Martin Luther King Jr.

sentences.en: The telegram was delivered early this morning.
sentences.cn: 这份电报是今天清晨送到的。
他给他们送来了一些货物。

sentences.en: Mr. Smith delivered the opening speech.

sentences.cn: 那位助产护士给她妹妹接生。

sentences.en: The enemy is going to deliver an attack during the dry season.
sentences.cn: 敌人准备在旱季发动攻势。

sentences.en: I delivered a verbal protest against their brutal acts.
sentences.cn: 我对他们的暴行提出口头抗议。

means.word_mean: 射出，喷出；排放；放出，排出(液体、气体等)；提供，供给

sentences.en: The oil well delivers 300 barrels a day.

means.word_mean: 实现意图(或期望)；履行，兑现诺言；不负众望(on)

sentences.en: to deliver on one's pledge (or promise)

jushi.english: The government promised reform of the tax laws but failed to deliver.
jushi.chinese: 政府曾答应税法改革但没有付诸实施。
